title: Leblanc needs a serious nerf. Now.
body:
Leblanc is an absolute joke and there is no one in this game who needs a nerf harder then she does.
Pros:
-Probably one of the biggest bursts in the game
-Has near unlimited mobility
-Massive outplay potential
-Massive juking potential
-Has defence mechanism with her passive
-Has escapes
-Has CC/Lockdown
-Low cooldowns
-Has AOE
-Range on Etheral chains is so long that burning flash doesn't break the chain, and it's a low cooldown ability. Burning flash should at LEAST break it.
-Can get in, take off half your hp or kill you and get out without taking any damage, this applies to lane or teamfights.

Cons:
-Squishy

replies.body: Remove the silence on her Q.

I find it very amazing how no one QQ'd about Talon, not even NA GD. Yet Riot's balancing team nerfed him because he got a lot of play up in high elo and it was evident how strong his silence was. Even though I'm a Talon main, I'd have to give it to the balancing team for finally doing a good nerf.

Well actually the reason they removed his silence was because Riot said all targeted silences will be removed from the game regardless of how strong the champion is, it was something they didn't want in this game as it has no counterplay to it especially for an assassin.
Malzahar and Garen? Or is it because they're skillshots and autoattacks? Removing Garen's silence will probably make him the absolute worst late game champion.
Malzahar's silence is a skillshot, Garen is melee and requires him to run up to your face in order to use the silence, completely different to a point and click silence like Talon's and Leblanc.

Talon's old silence was silly and overpowered if fed giving zero time to react, but reasonable if not. Because once you go in with Talon, you either kill everyone or die yourself. Rarely do you ever escape. LeBlanc is a very safe assassin. Malzahar can just spam his Q. Garen is pretty justified though.

Not here to discuss whats overpowered or not because i just don't want to go into that %%%%, but Malzahar can not spam his Q, have you ever played Malzahar? About three Q's and you're oom, its also a skillshot that isn't easy to hit and does little damage early.
Not talking about in lane. Mana regen is easy to get anyway.  I've played him, it isn't that hard to hit his Q against low mobility mages. Easy as piss to hit it against melees.

Lots of mages are able to spam there Q a lot more than Malzahar can, they also have long range Q's which Malzahar's Q is not, sure you've played him, but how many games, one? two? And you think this is a good defense? Its hard to hit against people that know how to dodge, also of course you can hit someone with low mobility, that's a stupid argument to make, all champions with low mobility are easier to hit with skill shots.

Not talking about what mages can spam their abilities the hardest, but the fact that Malzahar has a silence on his Q is what makes it powerful alongside that it can be spammed. Its hitbox isn't small, it's decent sized. Malzahar don't need no defense if his team can peel and destroy the target he ulted. His Q is also ranged, Talon has to actually go in and commit to the fight with his E (Unlike LeBlanc who can easily just W or R(W) out.) I mean it's easy to hit his Q against targets who don't have dashes like Yasuo, regardless of movement speed you can hit it.

Its a short ranged skillshot that cannot be spammed early, its hitbox is not easy to hit either, stop trying to argue this point, Malzahar's kit is fine as is, that includes the silence he has, don't know why you're trying to argue this point.
But Talon couldn't spam it early on either. Had a bigger CD, more risk associated to it etc. I have a feeling Malzahar will be FoTM in 2015.

Hmm, then why not make that silence scale with E? Because the silence really was only strong in lane where you could burst without the opponent retaliating, it wasn't all that later on in the game where the enemy ADC was or is always surrounded by their team or support (at least in my elo).

I still think Malz will become FoTM, people said and say the same things about Katarina, again like Talon etc. QSS costs gold and nobody rushes it first, supports rarely get Mikhaels because tank items are more efficient.. Would be a different scenario if Cleanse was actually useful and could remove suppression.

Hmm, then why not make that silence scale with E? Because the silence really was only strong in lane where you could burst without the opponent retaliating, it wasn't all that later on in the game where the enemy ADC was or is always surrounded by their team or support (at least in my elo).

I still think Malz will become FoTM, people said and say the same things about Katarina, again like Talon etc. QSS costs gold and nobody rushes it first, supports rarely get Mikhaels because tank items are more efficient.. Would be a different scenario if Cleanse was actually useful and could remove suppression.

Talons silence had no counterplay, he would jump on you then full combo you and you couldn't retaliate because you were silenced, he wasn't really overpowered he was a rather average champion, but that's besides the point, they wanted to remove those kinds of silences and they did.

Malzahar will not become FOTM because his kit doesn't work well in a competitive game, the way his kit is just isn't good against the current champions and on-top of that his ult is completely useless because QSS exists.

Also, we already have a Malzahar that's a strong pick, her name is Syndra.
